newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila share index climbs 1.86 pct at close.
newsitem.headline: Manila share index climbs 1.86 pct at close.

text.p: The Philippine share index snapped out of its two-day plunge on Wednesday, encouraged by the Dow's gains and improved sentiment on two property firms, traders said.
The market finished 53.11 points, or 1.86 percent higher, at 2,913.56
"This is a good comeback from the disaster yesterday. Across-the-board, the mood changed due possibly to the very sharp rise of the Dow," said Irving Ackerman at I. Ackerman & Co Inc.
Turnover was a substantial 2.58 billion pesos.
"The market just reacted to Wall Street's phenomenal rise and realisation that the fears on Empire and Megaworld were exaggerated," said Poch Zamora, dealer at Peregrine Securities.
Empire East Land Holdings Inc and parent firm Megaworld Properties & Holdings Inc which tumbled to lows for the year on Tuesday, bounced back on denials of rumours they were facing bankruptcy.

Megaworld closed at its intra-day high of 4.80 pesos, rising 28 percent. Empire East, the most heavily traded issue, also ended near its day-high of 4.80 pesos, finishing 1.10 pesos higher, or 30.14 percent, to 4.75 pesos.

Nathan Lozada, assistant vice-president at Philippine Asia Equity, said foreign investors may be back as they are seen dabbling in stocks such as Ayala Land Inc, Manila Electric Co and San Miguel Corp
Despite the gains, traders said market will remain cautious in the coming days and would look to the Dow for direction.
Traders said concerns about oversupply in the property sector would also continue to plague the market.
